intro: Trochocarpa nubicola, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals arranged in a trumpet shape. The leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its drought-resistant traits.
